standard_metadata.standard_description: Apply and extend previous understandings of addition and subtraction to add and subtract rational numbers; represent addition and subtraction on a horizontal or vertical number line diagram.

hints.content: Go to $2$, then move $8$ more to the right.
Here's one way to visualize it:  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line with evenly spaced tick marks in increments of 1. An arrow from 0 points 2 units to the right and is labeled as 2. Another arrow from this tick points 8 units to the right and is labeled as 8. A dotted line extends from the arrowheads to the corresponding ticks below.

hints.content: $2-(-8)$ takes us to $10$ on the number line.
Go to $8$, then move $3$ more to the right.
Here's one way to visualize it:  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line with evenly spaced tick marks in increments of 1. An arrow from 0 points 8 units to the right and is labeled as 8. Another arrow from this tick points 3 units to the right and is labeled as 3. A dotted line extends from the arrowheads to the corresponding ticks below.

hints.content: $8-(-3)$ takes us to $11$ on the number line.
Go to $5$, then move $2$ more to the right.
Here's one way to visualize it:  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line with evenly spaced tick marks in increments of 1. An arrow from 0 points 5 units to the right and is labeled as 5. Another arrow from this tick points 2 units to the right and is labeled as 2. A dotted line extends from the arrowheads to the corresponding ticks below.

hints.content: $5-(-2)$ takes us to $7$ on the number line.
Go to $8$, then move $7$ more to the right.
Here's one way to visualize it:  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line with evenly spaced tick marks in increments of 1. An arrow from 0 points 8 units to the right and is labeled as 8. Another arrow above this starting from the arrowhead points 7 units further to the right and is labeled as 7. A dotted line extends from the arrowheads to the corresponding ticks below.

hints.content: $8-(-7)$ takes us to $15$ on the number line.
Go to $3$, then move $6$ more to the right.
Here's one way to visualize it:  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line with evenly spaced tick marks in increments of 1. An arrow from 0 points 3 units to the right and is labeled as 3. Another arrow from this tick points 6 units to the right and is labeled as 6. A dotted line extends from the arrowheads to the corresponding ticks below.

hints.content: $3-(-6)$ takes us to $9$ on the number line.
Go to $2$, then move $2$ more to the right.
Here's one way to visualize it:  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line with evenly spaced tick marks in increments of 1. An arrow from 0 points 2 units to the right and is labeled as 2. Another arrow from this tick points 2 units to the right and is labeled as 2. A dotted line extends from the arrowheads to the corresponding ticks below.

hints.content: $2-(-2)$ takes us to $4$ on the number line.
Go to $4$, then move $4$ more to the right.
Here's one way to visualize it:  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line with evenly spaced tick marks in increments of 1. An arrow from 0 points 4 units to the right and is labeled as 4. Another arrow from this tick points 4 units to the right and is labeled as 4. A dotted line extends from the arrowheads to the corresponding ticks below.

hints.content: $4-(-4)$ takes us to $8$ on the number line.
Go to $3$, then move $3$ more to the right.
Here's one way to visualize it:  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line with evenly spaced tick marks in increments of 1. An arrow from 0 points 3 units to the right and is labeled as 3. Another arrow from this tick points 3 units to the right and is labeled as 3. A dotted line extends from the arrowheads to the corresponding ticks below.

hints.content: $3-(-3)$ takes us to $6$ on the number line.
Go to $4$, then move $8$ more to the right.
Here's one way to visualize it:  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line with evenly spaced tick marks in increments of 1. An arrow from 0 points 4 units to the right and is labeled as 4. Another arrow from this tick points 8 units to the right and is labeled as 8. A dotted line extends from the arrowheads to the corresponding ticks below.

hints.content: $4-(-8)$ takes us to $12$ on the number line.
Go to $-2$, then move $7$ back to the right.
Here's one way to visualize it:  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line with evenly spaced tick marks in increments of 1. An arrow from 0 points 2 units to the left and is labeled as negative 2. Another arrow above this starting from the arrowhead points 7 units to the right and is labeled as 7. A dotted line extends from the arrowheads to the corresponding ticks below.

hints.content: $-2-(-7)$ takes us to $5$ on the number line.
Go to $-9$, then move $4$ back to the right.
Here's one way to visualize it:  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line with evenly spaced tick marks in increments of 1. An arrow from 0 points 9 units to the left and is labeled as negative 9. Another arrow above this starting from the arrowhead points 4 units to the right and is labeled as 4. A dotted line extends from the arrowheads to the corresponding ticks below.

hints.content: $-9-(-4)$ takes us to $-5$ on the number line.
Go to $-4$, then move $2$ back to the right.
Here's one way to visualize it:  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line with evenly spaced tick marks in increments of 1. An arrow from 0 points 4 units to the left and is labeled as negative 4. Another arrow above this starting from the arrowhead points 2 units to the right and is labeled as 2. A dotted line extends from the arrowheads to the corresponding ticks below.

hints.content: $-4-(-2)$ takes us to $-2$ on the number line.
Go to $-3$, then move $1$ back to the right.
Here's one way to visualize it:  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line with evenly spaced tick marks in increments of 1. An arrow from 0 points 3 units to the left and is labeled as negative 3. Another arrow above this starting from the arrowhead points 1 unit to the right and is labeled as 1. A dotted line extends from the arrowheads to the corresponding ticks below.

hints.content: $-3-(-1)$ takes us to $-2$ on the number line.
Go to $-7$, then move $7$ back to the right.
Here's one way to visualize it:  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A number line with evenly spaced tick marks in increments of 1. An arrow from 0 points 7 units to the left and is labeled as negative 7. Another arrow above this starting from the arrowhead points 7 units to the right and is labeled as 7. A dotted line extends from the arrowheads to the corresponding ticks below.

hints.content: $-7-(-7)$ takes us to $0$ on the number line.
Go to $-5$, then move $6$ back to the right.

images.alt: A number line with evenly spaced tick marks in increments of 1. An arrow from 0 points 5 units to the left and is labeled as negative 5. hints.content: $-5-(-6)$ takes us to $1$ on the number line.

images.alt: A number line with evenly spaced tick marks in increments of 1. An arrow from 0 points 7 units to the left and is labeled as negative 7. hints.content: $-7-7$ takes us to $-14$ on the number line.

hints.content: $-1-9$ takes us to $-10$ on the number line.
